page.title: 04Rail Commuting from Bookham
page.content: Few Bookham households are without their{commuters,}most travelling from Bookham station. Business and professional men for{London}mix with school children for{Epsom, Dorking}and Guildford. Despite equality of opportunity, there are fewer female travellers and most of them are young. Although the number of passengers has greatly increased in the last 20 yrs the range & frequency of rail services has been steadily reduced, fares have risen sharply (an annual season ticket to London costs Â£750), trains are frequently cancelled and strikes occur. Only the time taken en-route remains the same. Many of us are away from home for 12 hours each day; but few would leave Bookham because of the attractions of our community in the evenings and at weekends.
